p: By removing the effect of richness on the ExpPD loss using null models (see methods), we found that the most significant losses were predominantly expected at low latitudes and eastern longitudes (Fig. 3). Islands with highly significant ExpPD loss were, among others: Madagascar, Borneo, New-Guinea, Tasmania, Sri Lanka, but also Cuba and Tierra del Fuego. For insular endemic genera, significant ExpPD loss was found, among others, for Madagascar, Indonesia (Sumatra, Borneo, New Guinea, Sulawesi), the West Indies (Cuba, Jamaica, Hispaniola), Honshu, Sri Lanka, and Tasmania (Fig. 3).
